provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. This Order may be cited as the Watersheds Protection (Rio
Minho, Cane River and Rio Nuevo Watersheds Areas) Order, 1964.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The areas specified in the Schedule are hereby declared to bc Schedule.
watershed areas for the purposes of the Act.
                                     SCHEDULE                                (Paragraph 2)
   Starting at the intersection of the centre line of the main road leading from
Frankfield to Nine Turns and the intersection of the centre line of the main
road leading from Trout Hall to Frankfield; thence north easterly in a straight
line to the interseclion of the centre line of the parochial road leading from
Frankfield to Carty H ~ l land the centre line of the parochial road leading from
Frankfield to Corner Shop; thence generally north easterly generally northerly
and generally north easterly along the centre line of the latter parochial road
to a point on this centre line situated 1100 ft. from the junction of this said
parochial road with the main road leading from Trout Hall to Comer Shop;
thence in a straight line on a grid-bearing of N13 OOE for a distance of 1650 ft;
thence south easterly in a straight line to its junction with the inter-
section of the centre line of the main road leading from Trout Hall to Corner
Shop and the centre line of a Bridle Road known as Flemmington Road
situated approximately 276 ft. south of Mile Post No. 48 on the last mentioned
main road; thence generally north easterly along the centre line of this said
Bridle Road to its intersection with the centre line of a Bridle Road leading
to Corner Shop and situated about 1100 ft. from the junction of the said
 Flemmington Road and the main road aforementioned; thence in a straight
 line on a grid-bearing of S59 30E for a distance of 2500 ft.; thence in a straight
 line on a grid-bearing of N82 OOE for a distance of 11,000 ft.; thence southerly
 in a straight line to its intersection with the centre line of the parochial road
leading from Brae Head to Reckford at a point approximately 4400 ft. measured
 north easterly along the said parochial road from its junction with the parochial
 road leading from Brae Head to Douces; thence south easterly in a straight
line to the north eastern comer of Lot 256 in Pennants Lands Settlement known
 also as Douces situated between lands said to belong to Zephaniah Goode and
 Zachariah Bonnick respectively; thence south westerly in a straight line to the
 north western corner of Lot 139 on the aforementioned Land Settlement
 registered at Volume 715 Folio 123 of the Register Book of Titles and said
 to belong to Kenneth W. Robinson; thence due west in a straight line to the
 centre line of the parochial road leading from Brae Head to Douces; thence

       RIO NUEVO WATERSHEDS AREAS) ORDER, 1964
generally southerly and generally south westerly along the centre line of the
parochial bridle road leading from Brae Head to Douces to its intersection
with the centre line of the parochial driving road leading from Brae Head to
Douces; thence generally southerly along the centre line of the said parochial
driving road to its intersection with the centre line of the main road leading
from Kupuis to Trout Hall; thence generally north westerly along the centre
line of the said main road to a point on the said centre line situated 1300 ft.
from the cenlrc !ine of the bridge over the Dawkiiis River on the last named
main road; thence in a straight line on a grid-bearing due west to its inter-
section with the centre line of the Rio Minho; thence generally south westerly,
generally south easterly, generally southerly, generally north easterly and generally
southerly along the centre line of the Rio Minho t o a point on this centre
line situated 8,900 ft. from the last mentioned intersection; thence in a straight
line on a grid-bearing due west to its intersection with the centre line of the
 pxochial bridle road leading from Main Ridge; thence generally southerly along
the ccntre line of this said parochial bridle rortd to its intersection with the
 centre line of the parochial r ~ a dleading frcm John Austin through Main
 Ridge to Long Look; thence generally westerly along the centre line of this latter
parochial road to its intersection with the centre line of n bridle road leading
from Orange Hill to Mount Hindmost near the western boundary of Somer-
ville; thcncc south easterly along the centre line of the said bridle road for
a distance of approximately 4,300 feet to its intersection with the centre line
.of a tributary of the Thomas River; thence generally southerly along the centre
line of the said tributary to its intersection with the centre line of the Thomas
 River; thence south westerly and generally westerly along the centre line of the
Thomas River to the centre line of the first tributary of the Thomas River
flowing from Blackwoods; thence generally southerly and south westerly along
the centre line of the said tributary to its intersection with the centre line
 of the parochial road leading from Blackwoods to the school at Elgin; thence
generally southerly along the centre line of this latter parochial road to its
 intersection with the centre line of the main road leading from Beckford
 Kraal to Thompson Town; thence in a straight line on a grid-bearing due
south for a distance of 2,000 feet; thence in a straight line on a grid-bearing
 of S77 30W for a distance of 7,000 feet; thence north westerly in a straight
line to its intersection with the centre line of the main road leading from
Thompson Town to Smithville and the centre line of the parochial road leading
 from Thompson Town to Balcarres; thence generally westerly and generally
 north westerly along the centre line of this latter parochial road to its inter-
 section with the centre line of a bridle road situated approximately 1200 ft. from
 the junction of this latter parochial road with the main road leading from
White Shop to Balcarres; thence generally north westerly, and generally northerly
along the centre line of the said bridle road to its intersection with the centre
line of the parochial road leading from Nine Turns to Ritchies; thence generally
 north eastcrly, generally south easterly, generally north exterly, generally south
easterly and generally southerly along the centre line of this latter parochial
 road to its intersection with the centre line of the main road lending from
 Frankfield to Nine Turns; thence easterly, generally north westerly, generally
 north easterly generally southerly, generally easterly, generally northerly, generally
 north westerly, generally northerly generally easterly generally south easterly
 and generally easterly along the centre line of the latter main road back to the
 starting point.
   Starting at the centre-line of the bridge over the Cane River on the parochial
road leading from Bull Bay to Lindo's Gap; thence in a straight line on a grid-
bearing due west for a distance of twenty-five hundred feet; thence in a straight
line on a grid-bearing of N33 OOW for a distance of eleven thousand three
hundred feet; thence north easterly in a straighr line to the intersection of the
centre-line of the parochial road leading from Millers Gap to August Town
with the centre-line of the parochial road leading from Bull Bay to Lindo's Gap;
thence generally northerly along the centre-line of the parochial road leading

from Lindo's Gap to Constitution Hill to its intersection with the centre-line
of the parochial road leading from Papine to Constitution Hill; thence generally
northerly, generally north easterly, generally easterly and generally south easterly
along the centre line of a bridle road leading from Constitution Hill to
Flamstead to its intersection with the centre line of the parochial bridle road
leading from Flamstead to Dallas, this latter intersection being approximately
eight hundred feet west of Flamstead House; thence generally easterly along
the centre line of the former bridle road to its intersection with the centre line
of the parochial bridle road leading from Bellevue to Mount Dispute; thence
north easterly along the centre line of the latter parochial bridle road to its
intersection with the centre line of the parochial bridle road leading from
Governors Bench to Bellevue; thence generally south easterly. westerly generally
 south westerly, southerly and generally south easterly along the centre line of tha
 latter parochial bridle road to its intersection with the centre line of the
parochial bridle road leading from Governors Bench to Mour?t Dispute; thence
generally southerly, generally easterly, generally south westerly, generally westerly
 and generally southerly along the centre line of the latter parochial bridle road to
its intersection with the centre line of the parochial bridle road leading from
 Mount Dispute to Halberstadt; thence generally south easterly almg the centre
 line of the latter parochial bridle road to its interxction wrth the centre line
of a bridle road running in the general direction of Lucky Valley, the lattcr
intersection being approximately 1100 ft. due west of Hal!mstndt House; thence
 in a straight line on a grid bearmg of S63 COW for a di~tanceof 5100 ft.; thmce
 in a straight line on a grid-bearing of S93 COW to its intersection with the
 centre line of the parochial road leading from Bito to Newstead; thence generally
 north westerly along the centre line of this latter parochial road to its intersec-
 tion with the centre line of the parochial road leading from Lucky Valley to
 Newstead; thence in a straight line on a grid-bearing due sonth for a distance
 of 1500 ft.; thence in a straight line on a grid-bearing of S67 OOW for a
 distance of 2800 ft.; thence in a straight line on a grid-bearink of N57 OOW
 for a distance of 1300 ft.; thence northerly in a straight line back to the
 starting point.
                           RIO N u ~ v oWATERSHED
                                                ARE&
   From the intersection of the centre linc of the m ~ i nroad leading from Rio
Nuevo to Salt Gut and the centre line of the private road leading from the
latter main road to Spring Valley overseer's house; thence southerly in a
straight line to its intersection with the centre line of parochial road No. 14
at a point 6,000 ft. measured generally south easterly along the said parochial
road from its junction with the main road leading from Retreat to Gayle;
thence south easterly in a straight line to its intersection with the centre line
of parochial road No. 35 at a point 4,000 ft. measured generally north easterly
along the said parochial road from its junction with parochial road No. 36;
 thence on a grid-bearing due south for 8,000 ft.; thence on a grid-bearing due
east for 4,000 ft.; thence north easterly in a straight line to its intersection
with the centre line of parochial road No. 40 at a point 4,000 ft. measured
generally northerly along the latter parochial road from its junction with the
main road leading .from. Dressikie to Union Hill; thence south easterly in
a straight line to its junction with the intersection of the cmtre line of the
latter main road and the centre h e of a reserved road leading from the said
 main road to Hill Top-this latter intersection being approximately midway
 between mile post 9 and 10 on the aboverhentioned main road; thence generally
 south easterly along the centre line of the latter reserved road to its common
 intersection with the centre line of parochial road No. 44 and the centre line
 of parochial road No. 174; thence generzlly south easterly along the centre line
 of parochial road No. 174 to its intersection with the centre line of the parochial
 road No. 55; thence generally south westerly and generally southerly along the
 centre line of the latter parochial road for a distance of approximately 1100 ft.
 to its intersection with the centre line of a reserved road leading from parochial
 road No.55 to parochial road No. 50; thence generally south easterly, generally
 easterly along the centre line of the said reserved road to its intersection with
 THE WATERSHEDS PROTECTION (RIO MINHO, CANE RIVER AND
       RIO NUEVO WATERSHEDS AREAS) ORDER, 1964
the centre line of parochial road No. 50; thence generally north easterly along
the centre line of the latter parochial road to its intersection with the centre
line of parochial road No. 170; thence generally easterly, generally south
easterly along the centre line of the latter parochial road for a distance of

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4,000 ft.; thence southerly in a straight line to Berry Hill Secondary Trigono-
metrical Station; thence southerly in a straight line. to its junction with the
intersection of the centre line of the main road from Hampstead to Farm
Turn and the centre line of parochial road No. 164; thence generally south
easterly along the centre line of the latter parochial road to its intersection with
the centre line of parochial road No. 163; thence generally southerly along the
centre line of parochial road No. 163 to its intersection with the centre line
of the main road leading from Palmetto Grove to Highgate; thence'generally
southerly, generally south easterly and generally easterly along the centre line
of the latter main road to its intersection with the centre line of parochial
road No. 72; thence continuing along the centre line of the said main road
generally south westerly, generally south easterly to its intersection with the
centre line of parochial road No. 80; thence generally south westerly, generally
 southerly generally south westerly along the centre line of parochial road
No. 80 for a distance of approximately 7,000 ft. to its intersection with the
 centre line of a bridle road leading from the latter parochial road to Woodside;
thence generally south westerly, generally north westerly along the centre line
 of the abovementioned bridle road to its intersection with the main road leading
 from Pear Tree Grove to Palmetto Grove at Woodside; thence generally south
 westerly along the centre line of the said main road for approximately 2,000 ft.
 to its intersection with the centre line of parochial road No. 75; thence north
 westerly in a straight line to its junction with the intersection of the centre line
 of the main road leading from Palmetto Grove to Guys Hill and the centre
 line of a parochial road leading from Carron Hall to meet the said main
 road-this latter intersection being approximately 1,500 ft. west of the Pnngle
 Home; thence generally westerly, generally south westerly along the centre
 line of the latter main road, passing through Windsor Castle and passing through
 Spring Field to its intersection with the centre line of the main road leading
 from Guys Hill to Lucky Hill-this latter intersection being at Guys Hill; thence
 generally northerly along the centre line of the main road through Maiden
 Hall through Wallenford and generally north easterly along the centre line of the
 said main road to its intersection with the centre line of parochial road No. 30;
 thence north westerly in a straight line to its junction with the intersection
 of the centre line of parochial road No. 22 and the centre line of the main
 road leading from Halifax to Lucky Hill; thence generally northerly along the
 centre line of the latter main road to its intersection with the centre line of
 the main road from Lucky Hill to Goshen; thence generally north westerly,
 generally south westerly, generally westerly along the centre line of the latter
 main road to its intersection with the centre line of parochial road No. 18, thence
 generally northerly along the centre line of the latter parochial road to its
 intersection with the centre line of parochial road No. 1-this latter intersection
 being at Labyrinth; thence generally north westerly along the centre line of
 parochial road No. 1 for approximately 9,000 ft, to its intersection with the
 centre line of the property road to "The Cascades"; thence northerly in a
 straight line to its junction with the intersection of the centre line of parochial
 road No. 8 and the centre line. of parochial road No. 6-the latter intersection
  being at Charles Town; thence northerly in a straight line to the centre
 line of the main road leading from Ocho Rios to Rio Nuevo at a point
 approximately 2,000 ft. east of Tower Isle; thence generally easterly, generally
 south easterly, generally north easterly along the centre line of the said main
  road back to the starting point.
